intro: Tournefortia astrotricha var. subglabra, commonly known as the smooth-leaved tournefortia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are smooth and glabrous, giving it its varietal name. Its flowers are typically yellow with five petals and are borne in clusters. This species is often found in coastal areas and thrives in sandy or well-drained soils.
